page.title: 15THOUGHTS OF A BLYTH FARMER
page.content: My family has farmed here for over 350 years. My land, covering 436 acres, ranges from 1 to 5 acre fields. I sow winter and spring barley, winter and autumn wheat, oil seed rape, linseed, oats, potatoes and cut grass for hay. My stock consists of Friesian and Hereford bulls. I employ 3 farm hands. I enjoy seeing the changing seasons, the interesting and varied work with nature and growing things.The changes I have seen in my lifetime are: horses being replaced by tractors, machines taking over the jobs of men, development of seeds which give higher yields but are more susceptible to disease resulting in a greater use of fertilisers,chemicals and sprays. A great deal of agricultural land has been taken away for urban use,such as houses, shops and similar amenities.My land has lessened as new houses appear
